Nuclear waste doesn t need a solution because it has never been a problem in the first place It s funny that this is always the first thing people think of but it s actually nuclear s big strength With wind power for example you are left with tons and tons of fiberglass blades that you can t recycle at the moment and need to bury old solar panels that are full of toxic materials get shipped to poor African countries batteries that you need for both again don t currently get recycled and have to get landfilled Nuclear waste Well all the nuclear waste ever produced in the US will fit into one warehouse That s the beauty of nuclear energy you only need one glass of nuclear fuel to cover your energy needs for life Because of this energy density very little waste gets produced and you can just leave it next to the plant You don t even need to bury it there is enough space there to last 100 years So that s all there is to it Nuclear waste currently doesn t contribute to any contamination whatsoever unless there are accidents of course and won t in the foreseeable future which can t be said of any other zero emission energy source Also contrary to popular perception nuclear waste doesn t stay radioactive for thousands of years Well yes it does but not in amounts that are actually dangerous What you are really worried about are the elements that have a short to medium half lives like Iodine 131 Strontium 90 or Caesium 134 137 The shorter the half life the more radioactive the element is The elements that stay radioactive for thousands of years like Uranium 238 or Plutonium 239 are not radioactive enough to be dangerous That s why you can go on a tourist tour of Chernobyl today 35 years after and be completely fine even though what happened there was completely uncontained
